moves.5. c3 Ba5 6. b4: This is somtimes conidered as a bad move but, as I planned to castle short, I thought it wasn't too dangerous.
moves.6... Bb6 7. Qb3: menacing the knight an the king
moves.7... d6 8. Bxg8 d5 9. Bxd5: White has already a far better game : direct menace on the king, stronger in the center, material advantage.
moves.10... c6 11. Bg8 Nd7: developping. White's plan is to attack c3
moves.12. Qe6+ Qe7 13. Qxe7+ Kxe7: The exchange favorise the one who has a material advantage
moves.15... Rd8: The attack on d4 seems to be a good idea but it is too slow.
moves.16. O-O: White castle to bring the tower on d1
moves.16... Nf8 17. Rd1: now, the attack d5 can begin
moves.17... Be6: Black develops but d5 is not protected enough
moves.18. d5 cxd5 19. exd5: Now, the bishop will have to remove and the e file will be free
moves.19... Bf5 20. Re1+: because of the two bishops on a and b files, black has little good squares for his king.
moves.20... Kd6 21. b5+: Now, white judges that it's time for this move.
moves.21... Bc5 22. Bxc5+ Kxc5 23. Rc1+: I hoped, black would be tempted to take on b5 so that his king is trapped on ths side
moves.23... Kxb5 24. Nc3+ Kb6 25. Nd4 g6: useless move. It would have been better to bring the a rook on c file

gameName: Walking the Walk and Learning to Run MT Part 4
